intro: Ceratoschoenus longirostris, commonly known as the long-beaked sea grass, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in shallow, brackish or freshwater environments, often forming dense underwater meadows. Its distinctive feature is its elongated, narrow leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for marine life.
